root.title: 23 Coopchegen
root.place: The horn was found by Coopchegen local school teacher Monosov in Kur-Kechu district.
root.store: Stored in The National Museum of Altai Republic named after Anochin. Inv # 9469.
root.description: The inscription is written on a small horn plate with size 25.5 х 4 cm. The text consists of 15 signs.
root.size: The horizontal length of the text is 10.7 cm, height of signs 1-1,2 cm.
root.investigation: Publications: Kubarev, Matochkin 536, Surazakov 537, Kyzlasov 538 539, Kocheev 523. Kyzlasov investigated the text.

pdf.f_title: Свод древнетюркских рунических памятников Горного Алтая. Горно-Алтайск: АКИН, 2006. – 52 с.

Кызласов И.Л. Рунические письменности евразийских степей.-М. 1994.-С. 318.-Рис. 18.
